thread.title: Patrick Dempsey Teams With Fifth Third Bank to Support Stand Up to Cancer
thread.title_full: Patrick Dempsey Teams With Fifth Third Bank to Support Stand Up to Cancer

author: Laura Woods
title: Patrick Dempsey Teams With Fifth Third Bank to Support Stand Up to Cancer
text:
By Laura Woods July 30, 2015 
Patrick Dempsey, who played the role of McDreamy on “Grey’s Anatomy,” has joined forces with Fifth Third Bank to Stand Up To Cancer (SU2C). The actor and newly minted race car driver has a very personal connection to the plight — he lost his mother to ovarian cancer in 2014. Fifth Third Bank will donate $150 to SU2C and $150 to new customers when they open an Essential Checking account and meet certain conditions. 
According to SU2C, a charitable initiative of the Entertainment Industry Foundation that raises money to fast-track the rate of groundbreaking cancer research, a total of 15 million new cases of cancer have been diagnosed since 1990. And, 1,500 people die from the disease each day. Patrick Dempsey and Fifth Third Bank Team Up to Support Stand Up to Cancer (SU2C) 
“With cancer impacting so many, we asked ourselves, ‘Could a bank help in the fight against this disease?’” said Maria Veltre, senior vice president and chief marketing officer for Fifth Third Bank, in a press release . “That was more than two years ago, and we’ve proven since that we can make a difference with the help of our customers, employees and members of our communities, and now leveraging the power of celebrity with Patrick Dempsey. With this campaign we want to highlight all the ways that we help fight every day.” 
Dempsey will serve as the spokesman for the campaign and is featured in a Fifth Third Bank public service announcement detailing the ways people can fight back against cancer. Over the past two years, the bank has joined in multiple marketing campaigns that have amassed $4.2 million in SU2C donations. 
Fifth Third Bank first partnered with SU2C in 2013 with the launch of the bank’s Fifth Third SU2C debit and credit cards. These cards allowed bank customers to raise money to support the cause by making qualifying purchases. The bank is also the only card issuer that provides SU2C payment cards. 
“Through this campaign, Fifth Third has made an everyday necessity a more meaningful experience for their customer by supporting Stand Up To Cancer’s innovative cancer research,” said Rusty Robertson, co-founder of SU2C, in the release. 
Read: What Are the Best Checking Account Features? Details About Fifth Third Bank’s Promotion 
Fifth Third Bank makes it easy to SU2C. All you have to do is open an Essential Checking account, enroll in direct deposit within 90 days and make three online bill payments using the bank’s online bill payment service within the 90-day time period. 
Within six weeks of completing the requirements, Fifth Third Bank will deposit $150 in your account and donate $150 to SU2C. Checking accounts must be opened between July 27, 2015, and Oct. 17, 2015. 
Additionally, during the promotional period, every time the #HowIFight hashtag is used on Facebook, Twitter, Vine or Instagram, the bank will donate $1 toward its maximum funding goal of $100,000. This campaign runs from through Oct. 17 as well.
